page.title: 05Farming To_day
page.content: Broadgate Farm, a typical Hampshire chalkland mixed farm of 360 acres. The stock consists of 120 milking cows, 13O heifers, 250 sheep and a small flock of pedigree Suffolk ewes for ram breeding. Barley is grown on 110 acres with 250 acres of grass. Milk production is 6500 litres per cow and sells at 15pence per litre. In calf heifers sell at Â£550, calves at Â£70/Â£100, young ewes at Â£70, and lambs at Â£45. Grain yields average 45/50cwts, sell at Â£100 per tonne. Animals are sold in the open market at Salisbury and Winchester, and at the Sheep Fair at Wilton. Cows are no longer milked by hand but put through a rotary milking parlour, where milk cups are attached to the teats and the milk is piped back to a tank and cooled, thence transported in bulk tankers to the factory.
